evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: a.  Assume jurisdiction over this matter;

extracted.value: Assume jurisdiction over this matter

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: b.  Certify the case as class action as proposed herein;

extracted.value: Certify the case as class action as proposed herein

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: c.  Appoint Plaintiffs as representatives of the class;

extracted.value: Appoint Plaintiffs as representatives of the class

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: d.  Declare that Defendants’ denial of SIJS and imposition of a new requirement for SIJS relief is contrary to state and federal law and violates the Immigration and Nationality and Administrative Procedure Act;

extracted.value: Declare that Defendants’ denial of SIJS and imposition of a new requirement for SIJS relief is contrary to state and federal law and violates the Immigration and Nationality and Administrative Procedure Act

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: e.  Declare that the imposition of a new requirement for SIJS eligibility and resulting denial of Plaintiffs’ and the putative class members’ SIJS petitions by USCIS were arbitrary;

extracted.value: Declare that the imposition of a new requirement for SIJS eligibility and resulting denial of Plaintiffs’ and the putative class members’ SIJS petitions by USCIS were arbitrary

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: f.  i.  Denying SIJS petitions on the grounds that a Washington state court does not have jurisdiction or authority to reunify an 18 to 20 year old with his or her parents;

extracted.value: Permanently enjoin Defendants from denying SIJS petitions on the grounds that a Washington state court does not have jurisdiction or authority to reunify an 18 to 20 year old with his or her parents

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: f.  ii.  Initiating removal proceedings against or removing any SIJS petitioner who was placed into the custody of a state agency or department pursuant to RCW § 13.40.300, appointed a guardian pursuant to RCW § 13.90.010 et seq., or placed into extended foster care under RCW § 13.34.267, and whose SIJS petition has been denied on the grounds that the Washington state court did not have authority to “reunify” an individual who has reached age 18 with his or her parents;

extracted.value: Permanently enjoin Defendants from initiating removal proceedings against or removing any SIJS petitioner who was placed into the custody of a state agency or department pursuant to RCW § 13.40.300, appointed a guardian pursuant to RCW § 13.90.010 et seq., or placed into extended foster care under RCW § 13.34.267, and whose SIJS petition has been denied on the grounds that the Washington state court did not have authority to “reunify” an individual who has reached age 18 with his or her parents

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: f.  iii.  Providing less than 14 days’ notice to Plaintiffs’ counsel before Defendants take any adverse adjudicatory or enforcement action against any of the Plaintiffs or members of the Proposed class during the pendency of this litigation;

extracted.value: Permanently enjoin Defendants from providing less than 14 days’ notice to Plaintiffs’ counsel before Defendants take any adverse adjudicatory or enforcement action against any of the Plaintiffs or members of the Proposed class during the pendency of this litigation

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: f.  iv.  Delaying the adjudication of class members’ SIJS petitions beyond the statutory 180-day deadline for rendering a decision on such petitions;

extracted.value: Permanently enjoin Defendants from delaying the adjudication of class members’ SIJS petitions beyond the statutory 180-day deadline for rendering a decision on such petitions

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: g.  Rescind the improper denials of Plaintiffs’ and class members’ SIJS petitions, and order USCIS to reopen their petitions;

extracted.value: Rescind the improper denials of Plaintiffs’ and class members’ SIJS petitions, and order USCIS to reopen their petitions

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: h.  Award Plaintiffs’ counsel reasonable attorneys’ fees under the Equal Access to Justice Act, and any other applicable statute or regulation;

extracted.value: Award Plaintiffs’ counsel reasonable attorneys’ fees under the Equal Access to Justice Act, and any other applicable statute or regulation

evidence.source_document: Complaint - Class Action for Injunctive and Declaratory Relief
evidence.text: i.  Grant such further relief as the Court deems just, equitable, and appropriate.

extracted.value: Grant such further relief as the Court deems just, equitable, and appropriate
